title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
I am a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Public Administration at the University of Illinois Chicago, specializing in collaborative governance, regional intergovernmental organizations, and social network analysis. My research delves into the intricacies of how governments work together to solve complex challenges that transcend jurisdictional boundaries. Specifically, I explore the dynamics within decentralized local systems and their interconnections, examining the ways in which local governments leverage various institutional frameworks to address issues that extend beyond their immediate administrative borders.





I am also a member of the Network and Governance Lab with a bunch of awesome researchers diving into all sorts of cool stuff! Check out our lab’s website to see the amazing research we’re up to!

title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Peer-reviewed Articles
Zhang, S., & Zehra, M.-E.-. (2024). Exploring Accountability Choices in Service Contracts for Collaborative PublicSafetyServices Provision. State and Local Government Review, 56(1), 6-25. https://doi.org/10.1177/0160323X231208958
Zhang, S.; Li, J. & Carr, J. Relational Contracting thru Selection-Based Accountability: Collaboration History, Shared Constituencies, and Justified Trust in Public Safety Contracts. Under Review at Public Performance & Management Review

title: Shuwen Zhang

title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Awards
Donald C. Stone Award for Best Student Paper from the Section on Intergovernmental Administration and Management at American Society for Public Administration Annual Conference (Apr. 2023)

title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Our research about how power difference affects the use of monitoring mechanisms in ILAs is published in State and Local Government Review! [Check it out here!]



My research titled: “How Does Cities’ Engagement Affect the Function of Regional Intergovernmental Organizations (RIGOs) in Metropolitan Areas?” has won the Donald C. Stone Award for Best Student Paper 2023! [More…]

title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Thank you for visiting my website. I am genuinely interested in hearing from you. Whether you have questions about my research, are interested in collaboration, or simply wish to share your thoughts, please do not hesitate to reach out.
University Email: szhan47@uic.edu
Personal Email: shuwenzhang1105@outlook.com

title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Meet Dumpling, the Research Whiz!

Behold Dumpling: part cat, part research assistant, all fluff. He’s huge, he’s friendly, and he’s probably way smarter than me. Research just got a lot more purr-sonal!
